data.title: A Letter from North American Jews to the Israeli Government: Make a Deal Now to Bring the Hostages Home, End the War
data.text:
As North American Jews who care deeply about the future of Israel, we urge you to make a hostage and cease-fire deal and bring the hostages home. There is no time to waste.

In doing so, we stand with the families of hostages who for months have been protesting in the streets in Israel and echo their desperate call to prioritize the lives of their family members — something your government has repeatedly failed to do. The majority of Israelis also share this desire to end the suffering of the hostages and their families and to avoid a full-scale invasion of Rafah, which is clear from widespread protests this week.

Saving lives is a Jewish moral imperative — all the more so saving Jewish captives, which our tradition teaches is a mitzvah of the highest order. In his law code, Maimonides places this rule in the context of other collective obligations; Mikhael Manekin, a founder of Smol Emuni/the Faithful Left, explains that this emphasizes how captives are “signifiers of communal responsibility, of what the idea of peoplehood means in practice.” The State of Israel is supposed to be a safe harbor for Jews, yet you have abandoned Jewish hostages in the name of endless war.

Recognizing that every human being is created in the image of the Divine also means recognizing the humanity of those across the border. Innocent Palestinians do not deserve to be punished for Hamas’s crimes. Israeli military action has caused widespread famine, displacement and homelessness, and devastation of societal infrastructure in Gaza. Tens of thousands of people have been killed, including thousands of children. Hamas’s war crimes do not justify additional war crimes.

Right now, you have an opportunity to end the unbearable suffering of so many and to bring home Israelis who have spent seven months languishing in Gaza’s tunnels.

Please take it.

Sincerely,

Jennifer Abel – Oakland, CA

Marian Abernathy – Durham, NC

Dr. David Abraham – Monroe, NJ

Judith Abraham – Toronto, ON
